Today, we finish our series on SkoHub with a post about SkoHub PubSub which is the component that adds ActivityPub features to SKOS concepts: http://blog.lobid.org/2020/06/25/skohub-pubsub.html

item.title: Blog post about SkoHub Editor
item.dc:creator: acka47
item.description:
See http://blog.lobid.org/2020/03/31/skohub-editor.html

In a nutshell, SkoHub Editor enables the automatic generation of a web form based on a JSON schema, along with the possibility to look up terms in a controlled vocabulary that is published with SkoHub Vocabs. Additionally, metadata generated by the editor can be published using the ActivityPub-based SkoHub PubSub

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: About SkoHub
item.dc:creator: acka47
item.description:
SkoHub – Simple Knowledge Organization Hub

SkoHub supports a novel approach for finding content on the web. The general idea is to extend the scope of Knowledge Organization Systems (KOS) to also act as communication hubs for publishers and information seekers. In effect, SkoHub allows to follow specific subjects in order to be notified when new content about that subject is published.

5 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
